oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Insemination of cattle with semen from a bull transiently infected with pestivirus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kirkland, P. D.
McGowan, M. R.
Mackintosh, S. G.
Moyle, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pestivirus
contaminated semen
transiently bull
systemic infection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: When 73 heifers (60 of which were seronegative to pestivirus) were inseminated with pestivirus-contaminated semen from a transiently bull, the conception rate to a single insemination was found to be normal (65 percent). Only three animals became systemically infected, as determined by viraemia and seroconversion. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1997) 140, 124-127
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1997; 187
